function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Underestimation of modes of transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential risk of cross-contamination from stainless steel surfaces due to inadequate cleaning procedures and disinfectant application.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"No in vitro data on efficacy of hand washing against coronavirus contamination on hands.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Compliance with hand hygiene is likely to remain an obstacle, especially among physicians.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Human coronaviruses can remain infectious on inanimate surfaces for up to 9 days.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertain viral load on inanimate surfaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unknown frequency of hand contamination with coronavirus","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conflicting data on benzalkonium chloride efficacy against coronavirus at different concentrations and contact times.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Long persistence of coronaviruses on inanimate surfaces, up to 9 days at room temperature and 28 days at higher temperatures.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High transfer efficiency of viral load to hands from contaminated surfaces, with potential transfer to the face and mucous membranes.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Coronavirus persistence on surfaces and materials","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variation in coronavirus persistence based on temperature and humidity","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effectiveness of biocidal agents in inactivating coronaviruses","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Person-to-person transmission of coronavirus in hospital and family settings.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contaminated dry surfaces serving as a potential source of coronavirus transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of coronavirus persistence on inanimate surfaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation in green housing may lead to the propagation of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor construction practices in prefabricated dwellings may lead to the accumulation of harmful microbes and contagions.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fragmented research on the interaction between covid-19, housing policies, and green housing may lead to incomplete understanding of the components.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of micro-level building and macro-level city, country aspects of green housing during and after the covid-19 era may result in ineffective housing policies.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on crisis-response measures, support for tenants and owners, and recovery strategies in housing policies may increase the risk of disease propagation and affect resident wellbeing.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of how buildings affect health in the context of a pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainties caused by the covid-19 pandemic leading to a lack of pragmatic instructions to reduce indoor risks","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for revision of building codes and certification processes to address specific pandemic-related needs","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in the built environment due to inadequate building hygiene and wellbeing.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate indoor environment leading to poor air quality and health issues.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Human behavior and lifestyle affecting the spread of contagious diseases within the built environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of appropriate home environments for at-home work during covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate management of infrastructural and technical facilities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient adaptation of facilities management in response to covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of disease transmission in crowded living spaces due to pandemic restrictions.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate access to green spaces and outdoor environments in housing designs.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited research on the relationship between green housing and covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interactions between covid-19, housing policies, and resident behaviors influence green housing requirements","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited evidence on the impact of green housing in the context of covid-19 pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive coverage of all affected countries in the literature review","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of investigation into the impact of housing policies on green housing and resident wellbeing during covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient analysis of the impact of green buildings, interest groups, and covid-19 on the built environment","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through shared personal comfort systems pcs in the built environment.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased human-machine interaction","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Slow movement of the internet of things towards humanization","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Scientific studies on indoor air quality","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased online shopping leading to empty retail spaces","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Obsolete parking spaces due to decreased demand","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in land use and zoning due to remote living and working","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Homeless people living in close quarters in shelters and motels","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Drastic decline in public transit use and services","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disruption in ride-share services and bike sharing","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Surging demand through most of 2020 caused by demographic trends and the pandemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lowest rate of home value appreciation since
